moves.1. d4: This game was between two evenly matched opponents.  I end up with a sweet mate in the end.
moves.1... d5 2. Nc3 c6: Im looking to transpose into the caro-kann
moves.4... Bf5: This is the standard reply forcing his knight to flee.  Instead he surprised me by comprimising his kingside on the next move
moves.5. f3: His h4-e1 diagonal is exposed.  But there are no immediate attacks.
moves.5... e6: This allows me to develop my dsb.  If I develop my kings knight instead this would put my Queen on f6 after the knight exchange.  This would be more favorable to white.
moves.6. g4: This move surprised me even more now white must castle long
moves.6... Bg6 7. h4: White is going early for a full kingside attack
moves.7... h6 8. h5 Bh7 9. Nc5: A mistake by white as you will see
moves.11... Ne7: Best square to develop my kings knight
moves.12. Bf4: This is a good move by white because it prevents me from castling long which is what I wanted to do because of his kingside attack
moves.12... Nd7: I develop my other knight and attack the doubled pawn at c5
moves.13. b4 O-O: I castle to connect my rooks. Is this a bad move?  I dont know
moves.14. Bd3 e5 15. Bxh7+ Kxh7: That was expected but now he has to retreat his bishop
moves.16. Be3 Rad8: Getting my rook on the same file as his king
moves.17. Ke2 Nd5 18. a3: White forms a good pawn chain on the queenside
moves.18... Nxe3 19. Kxe3 a5: I destroy the pawn chain with this move
moves.20. bxa5 Nxc5 21. Ne2: White was a little late in developing his knight
moves.21... Rfe8 22. Rab1: White goes after my backward pawn
moves.22... e4 23. fxe4 Rxe4+ 24. Kf3 Rd7: I protect the backward pawn moving beside it because im afraid of the advancing a pawn.
moves.25. Nc3: This was a mistake as youll see later
moves.25... Rc4: Now white must move his knight and surrender the backward pawn
moves.26. Ne2 Rxc2 27. Rhc1: I decide to not play his game by exchanging rooks and put him in check instead
moves.27... Rd3+ 28. Kf4 Ne6+: I dont have to worry about the rook if I can put him in check.  I see a possible mate ahead.
moves.29. Ke4 Rcd2: I did not take the knight because I would have lost the rook to his king
moves.30. Rxb7: I dont worry about the backward pawn because it is mate in four
